body.name: Small Desk Fan, 2000mAh Rechargeable USB Fan Battery Operated,Ultra Quiet, Strong Wind, 3 Speeds Travel Fan
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Thursday, February 22 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35. Order within 5 hrs 55 mins
features: Battery & USB Powered Fan：This 7-Inch desk fan from Tevelecin has a dual power source: battery powered and USB! rechargeable fan with built-in upgraded 2000mAh battery, long working time portable fan for camping, traveling and other working. (Speed 1: 12hours; Speed 2: 8.5hours; Speed 3: 4.5hours.) You can also plug it into power supply for continuous work.

Ultra Quiet Fan：Unique upgrade blade design engineered to be 25% quieter. The min noise of this desk fan is close to 25db, This mini fan is quiet enough but still powerful for a cool breeze, gives you a comfortable work environment. Perfect choice to use while working and studying.

180°Tilt Adjustable：desktop fan with a 180-degree swivel stand that can stand or hang. you will always be comfortable and cool, just customize the angle and enjoy your cooling with this powerful and quiet fan.This compact fan won’t take up much space and features a convenient folding design for easy storage and transport. It’s perfect for the office, dorm rooms, hotel stays, cruise ship travel and summer camp!

3-Stage Adjustable Wind Speed & Quietness：The speed of this portable desk battery fan can also be adjusted among low, medium, and high according to your demands. it is decent and quiet which ensure the peaceful flow of air, and enough for personal.

Package Content & Customer Service：You get one Tevelecin Portable Battery Desk Fan, one USB cable, one user guide, Please write amazon email to us for help if meeting any problem. We will respond within 24-hours.
Note: The fan blades are either transparent white or match the color of the fan casing; both colors are randomly dispatched.

Specification Brand Tevelecin Model Name F5 Name Ultra-Thin Table Fan Input DC 5V/2A Power 5.0W MAX Wind Speed 13 Ft/s MAX Rotation Speed 2300 RPM Noise Level ≤ 25 dB Battery Type Lithium-Ion Battery Capacity 2000 mAh (16.6Wh/3.7V) Charging Time 3 - 4 Hours Work Time 4 - 12 Hours Lifetime > 20,000 Hours Weight 0.5 Lb Dimension 5.7*6.9*1.5 IN

Does this table fan make a huge sound? Not at all, our Whisper-Quiet Table Fan is seamlessly quiet. You can barely hear it running and will not be disturbing your concentration. Can you tell me how many colors it comes in? Sure, we offer this USB table fan in six different colors. You can choose from creamy white, white, black, green, blue, and pink. We have a variety of options to suit your personal style and home decor. Can I use this personal fan without the USB charging cable connected? Yes, it has a 2,000 mAh large-capacity battery inside the columnar base that allows it to run for up to 12 hours without being plugged in. With a single charge, you can use it all day long. Can I use this personal fan while it's charging? Are there any safety concerns? Yes, you can use our fan while it's charging. It's both safe and easy to use, so you don't need to worry about its durability. Feel free to enjoy uninterrupted cooling comfort! How long will this portable fan work after it's fully charged? Can I take it outdoors for half a day? The battery life is quite impressive, and it can run for at least 4 hours on speed level 3. If you use it on speed level 1, it can work for a whole day. So, you can definitely take it outdoors for half a day without any issues.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Pretty nice portable fan to carry in my bag
reviews.reviewText: I've been using my fan for a few months and just bought a second one for Christmas gift exchanges while it was on sale.Overall I'm happy with this. It is not perfect, but it is convenient and solved some problems a slightly bulkier fan was giving me.I have a Honeywell mini fan that I like quite a bit, but it it bulkier and was not convenient to carry in my small messenger bag. It also didn't have an internal battery, though you could run it off of AA batteries, which had positives and negatives.I wanted a slimmer fan that was flatter and fit in my compact bag and this one fits the bill. It slips into my snug, small bag pretty well. There is a bit of a bulge on the back, but it is much slimmer than the honeywell.The internal battery is convenient; I don't have to carry batteries with me. And it has a USB-C port, so I can use the cables I already carry with me instead of a proprietary charge cable.It has 3 speed settings where the Honeywell only has one, but the top-setting is about the same as the Honeywell. The 1st setting is pretty worthless, though now that the weather is cooler the 2nd setting is useful sometimes.Some other reviewers have noted that the button that is flat on the front poses a danger of turning the fan on if it's bumped in your bad. This has happened to me maybe twice in the past few months. It's certainly possible, but I have not found it to not happen very often. And I have been carrying it in a pretty tightly packed, slim bag.The noise level. I think when I first got it I noticed the sound was maybe ever-so-slightly higher-pitch. Not loud, but if you have it on silently you can notice it. If you're using it where there's some ambient noise around you it won't be noticeable and at this point I don't notice it. I can be sensitive to obnoxious sounds and this doesn't bother me at all.The built-in stand it pretty good. It cleanly folds up to help the fan stay flat and low-profile. However, it gets in the way of the charge port. It will certainly still let you stand it up while charging, but it will limit the angle a little and the base of your cable will have to bend around it. I can work around it okay, but it does put it as a slightly less ideal angle sometimes.The internal battery is nice. You can charge it up with your same USB chargers and cables. It runs off a USB power pack fine. The life isn't crazy; I can get maybe 3-4 hours on high-power (i feel like closer to 4, though I haven't timed it scientifically). In comparison, I could get almost 8 hours off 4 AA-batteries on my Honeywell, though the last hour or so the power weakens until it peters out. This one goes strong until right before it peters out, but that said it does not last as long on a charge. But I find it quite adequate and the ease of charging/plugging in makes it easy to deal with. I always wish batteries lasted longer; a full "workday" is ideal. This doesn't make it, but I don't feel disappointed using it.The build quality...I mean, it's not a high-dollar item. It feels solid and it's getting the job done; it doesn't feel flimsy. But I'm not expecting it to last forever. That said, it is priced well and is well worth the price.So to try to sum things up:- Good compact size that folds relatively flat- 3 power settings, 2 of which are very useful to me.- Sound i maybe a little higher pitch but is not at all obnoxious or "loud".- Adequate battery life, ~4 hours on high-speed setting.- Easy to charge with USB-C port; no proprietary charge cable. But the placement of the port can slightly impact stand angles if you're charging/powering the fan with a cable plugged inOverall I am very happy with this. Even when I went back to carrying a bigger bag that can accommodate my bulkier Honeywell fan, I've kept using this because it's just more convenient to fit in my bag and to charge without a special cable. So if you get hot when you eat at a restaurant or work at a coffee shop/library, I'd definitely recommend you carry one of these in your bag. It's easy to carry around, to setup and put away, and to charge internally or with an external power source. It makes my life a lot easier when I'm setting up at tables/desks when I'm away from home.

reviews.reviewTitle: Ideal Small Fan for Home and Travel
reviews.reviewText: This is a very simple device that provides adequate personal air movement. This is not designed to provide air movement for an entire room, but it ideal for a desk top at work, home or hotel room. I have found that there is more that adequate air movement at each level, and the noise level is low. I would recommend this fan for personal use.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 27, 2024
reviews.reviewText: As far as I am concerned, there is nothing to dislike about this small, neat, desk top/bedside table fan. For its size, the fan is very efficient, even on the lowest setting. There are three settings, but I keep mine on the lowest one and it is enough. Charging is simple with the supplied cable, and the red charging light turns to blue when the fan is fully charged. Depending on how long the fan is in use, depends on how often and for how it needs charging. Mine has not run out of charge yet,, but I keep the batteries topped up either on a daily basis or on alternate days - I like to know it is ready for use when I need it, mostly at bedtime at present. The fan is quiet on the low setting, louder on the other two, but not excessively so and the movement of cool air it creates, is just right for me. How long a fan of such a small size will last, I cannot say, but having acquired it, I would not like to be without it, so, I am going to order another one as soon as I can. The fan comes in a range of colours to suit taste/decor, I chose cream and the only adverse thing about it is, it states on Amazon that the base will turn so the fan can be at an angle. My fan doesn't do this, but I maybe 'missing a trick'. It isn't a problem, however, as the compact nature of the fan, and it isn't heavy, allows for easy movement and positioning as required. Altogether, a worthwhile purchase and fully deserving of five stars. It was delivered promptly and securely packed for transit.

Estoy contento por la compra, es muy funcional, no hace ruido, yo lo conecto a mi lap, y lo puedo moverá cualquier lugar gracias a que tiene una pila interna que dura 2 horas aprox...- no tiene indicador de batería, pero es lo de menos-
